newsitem.title: USA: HUBCO to buy Southington in shr swap.
newsitem.headline: HUBCO to buy Southington in shr swap.

text.p: HUBCO Inc said Monday it signed a definitive agreement to buy the Bank of Southington for about $21.00 a share in a stock exchange transaction.

HUBCO said it will exchange one of its shares priced at $21 for each share Bank of Southington shareholders hold, if the median closing price of HUBCO's stock in the period before the deal's closing is between $27.50 and $35.00.

It added Southington shareholders will receive 0.6 HUBCO shares for each share they hold if HUBCO's stock price averages more than $35.00 in the period. Conversely, Southington shareholders will receive 0.764 HUBCO shares for each of their shares if HUBCO's stock price averages less than $27.50 in the period.
HUBCO said the Southington board has certain rights to cancel the deal if the median HUBCO stock price is below $22.00 in the preriod.

HUBCO said it will merge Southington into its Connecticut subsidiary, Lafayette American Bank, which will have about $1.4 billion in assets and 30 offices after the merger. It added its other subsidiary, Hudson United Bank, has about $1.7 billion in assets and 57 offices.

The bank holding company said the $21.00 a share offer for Southington equals 229 percent of its book value and 22.6 times Southington's earnings per share. It added Southington could issue 275,000 shares to HUBCO as part of the deal, which it structured as a tax-free exchange and will account for as a pooling of interest.
HUBCO's stock dropped 3/4 to 30-1/4 Monday morning, while Southington's stock closed at 21-1/2 Thursday.
